title: Kinetic energy - falling with air resistance

content.question: Two groups of students each construct a sketch to predict the kinetic energy of a falling object that is subject to air resistance as it falls. Which group has produced a correct graph, and how can this selection be justified?

choices.label: Group <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because the slope of an object’s kinetic energy graph is proportional to its acceleration.

Group <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because the object’s speed is increasing at a decreasing rate, so its kinetic energy is also increasing at a decreasing rate.
Group <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> because it shows that the kinetic energy decreases as the magnitude of its acceleration decreases.
Group <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> because as the object falls it will approach a terminal speed which is where the speed reaches a horizontal asymptote.

content.answer: Group <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> because the object’s speed is increasing at a decreasing rate, so its kinetic energy is also increasing at a decreasing rate.
